channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Earnings and a potential kidney disease breakthrough

item.title: Cord cutters prepare for political ad blitz as campaigns flood Roku, Hulu ahead of election
item.description: Connected TV are capturing more political advertising dollars than ever as campaigns rush to reach prospective voters.

item.title: Alibaba jumps 4% in premarket after it completes three-year regulatory overhaul
item.description: Alibaba has completed a three-year regulatory "rectification" process following an antitrust fine it received for monopolistic practices in 2021, China's market regulator said on Friday.

item.title: Positive earnings and advanced talks have these stocks moving

item.title: Bank of America sees potential for a reversal in bond yields
item.description: Strategists at Bank of America says there‚Äôs a potential for a reversal in bond yields, particularly at the long end.

item.title: Here's how data centers became a billion-dollar real estate investment
item.description: The U.S. has most of the world's data centers. The concentration has caused the value of the land they're built on to soar. Investors are putting money to work.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: A tale of tier 2 cities
item.description: India's economic map is being redrawn.

item.title: The markets will rise or fall with NVDA

item.title: The ‚ÄòLow-Wage 100‚Äô spend more on share buybacks that enrich executives than on their businesses. Lawmakers are taking note.
item.description: A new report on the 100 S&P 500 companies with the lowest median pay finds the buyback machine is still in overdrive.

item.title: Elon Musk's X can proceed to trial in case against Media Matters after Texas judge denies dismissal request
item.description: A federal judge in Texas has ruled against Media Matters and its request to dismiss a lawsuit filed by Elon Musk's X

item.title: This 29-year-old from one of London's poorest neighborhoods became a millionaire after selling his influencer marketing firm
item.description: Timothy Armoo grew up poor on a council estate in South London. Here's how he became a millionaire before the age of 30.

item.title: Here‚Äôs how much athletes at the Paris Paralympics earn for winning medals
item.description: While the International Paralympic Committee does not dole out prize money for winning medals, several countries do reward their athletes with medal bonuses.

item.title: Euro zone inflation falls to 3-year low of 2.2%, backing September rate cut case
item.description: Economics polled by Reuters had forecast a decline to 2.2% in August, down from 2.6% in July.

item.title: Emergent BioSolutions‚Äô stock soars 23% after FDA approves its smallpox vaccine for mpox
item.description: The Emergent vaccine is now the second one to win FDA approval after one developed by Danish biotech Bavarian Nordic.

item.title: Harris defends border record, rips Trump for killing bipartisan bill
item.description: Democratic nominee Kamala Harris and running mate Tim Walz held their first interview since President Joe Biden dropped his reelection bid against Donald Trump.

item.title: China‚Äôs Zeekr targets global markets with its electric SUV, priced to undercut Tesla‚Äôs Model Y
item.description: China's electric vehicle company, Zeekr, announced Friday that it will launch its first SUV in China on Sep. 20, starting at US$33,700, to compete with Tesla.
